etymology.description: semantic: 大 ('big; great') + phonetic: 可 (OC *kʰaːlʔ)
etymology.interpretation: 大 contributes the idea of greatness or standing out, while 可 provides the sound value. Combined, it evokes something notable or out of the ordinary, which develops senses like 'strange', 'unusual', and 'wonderful'.

examples.chinese: 这个想法很奇怪(這個想法很奇怪)。
她弹得真奇妙(她彈得真奇妙)。
这种鸟在这里很稀奇(這種鳥在這裡很稀奇)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng niǎo zài zhèlǐ hěn xīqí.
examples.english: This kind of bird is rare here.
